channel.title: Peoples on Division of Formal Methods
channel.description: Recent content in Peoples on Division of Formal Methods

item.title: Yu-Ting Jeff Chen
item.description: Hello my name is Jeff and I work at the division of Formal Method. I am a PhD student at Chalmers University of Technology, under the supervision of Professor Carlo A. Furia. Research interests := + Formal Methods, + Program Verification, + Intermediate Verification Languages contact := yutingc at chalmers dot se office := EDIT building room 5449 supervisor := Prof. Carlo A. Furia / Prof. Laura Kovács / Prof. Wolfgang Ahrendt

item.title: Raúl Pardo
item.description: Raúl Pardo: Research area: My research is focused on developing rigorous techniques to design, analyse and build software to protect online privacy. My interests lie at the intersection of formal methods, online privacy and computer security. Currently, I am working in the following topics:Formal models for privacy, Verification of smart contracts, Algorithm transparency [[https://dblp.org/pers/hd/p/Pardo:Ra=uacute=l][dblp link]] [[http://raulpardo.net][personal page]]

item.title: Simon Robillard
item.description: Simon Robillard: Research area: first-order theorem proving and its applications to program verification, more specifically my research interests are: Automated reasoning, Theorem proving, program verification, Type theory and Parallel programming [[https://dblp.uni-trier.de/pers/hd/r/Robillard:Simon][dblp link]] [[http://www.cse.chalmers.se/~simrob/][personal page]]

item.title: Jesús Mauricio Chimento
item.description: Jesús Mauricio Chimento: Research area: My research interests focus on studying Formal Methods, Certified Programming and Functional Programming. Regarding Formal Methods, I am keen on studying Program Specification and Program Verification, in particular Theorem Proving and Runtime Verification. [[https://dblp.uni-trier.de/pers/hd/c/Chimento:Jes=uacute=s_Mauricio][dblp link]] [[http://cse-212294.cse.chalmers.se/chimento/][personal page]]

item.title: Sandro Stucki
item.description: Sandro Stucki: Research area: In my research, I like to explore the many aspects of programming languages. I’m particularly interested in type systems and theory, the semantics and implementation of domain-specific languages, as well as formal methods for scientific modeling. Until recently, I spent my time pondering the type safety of Scala and related type systems. These days, I’m busy applying formal methods and type theory to problems in privacy and security, and hacking type soundness proofs in Agda.

item.title: Laura Kovács
item.description: Laura Kovacs: Professor Research area: My research is on formal software analysis and verification. More specifically, I am interested in designing new methods for computer-aided verification by combining: automated theorem proving, automated assertion generation, symbolic computation. [[https://dblp.uni-trier.de/pers/hd/k/Kov=aacute=cs:Laura][dblp link]] [[http://www.cse.chalmers.se/~laurako/][personal page]] related projects: [[https://vprover.github.io][Vampire: resolution-based automatic theorem prover]]

item.title: Nir Piterman
item.description: Nir Piterman: Professor Research area: My research interests include formal verification and automata theory. I have worked (and still am) on model checking of various types of systems, different aspects of temporal logic, as well as synthesis and game solving. I am also working on applications of formal methods to biological modeling. [[https://dblp.uni-trier.de/pers/hd/p/Piterman:Nir][dblp link]] TODO [[https://www.cs.le.ac.uk/people/npiterman/][personal page]] related projects: TODO [[https://www.cs.le.ac.uk/people/npiterman/][DSynMA: Distributed Synthesis from Single to Multiple Agents]]

item.title: Moa Johansson
item.description: Professor + Research area: learning and exploration in automated theorem proving, automated reasoning about recursive programs, reasoning for program analysis, automated discovery of inductive lemmas. + [[https://dblp.uni-trier.de/pers/hd/j/Johansson:Moa][dblp link]] + [[http://www.cse.chalmers.se/~jomoa/][personal page]] + related projects: - [[http://hackage.haskell.org/package/quickspec][QuickSpec]] - [[https://github.com/danr/hipspec][HipSpec]]
